newsitem.title: UK: Amnesty urges Albania to shun murder, mutilation.
newsitem.headline: Amnesty urges Albania to shun murder, mutilation.

text.p: Amnesty International issued an urgent appeal to Albanians on Friday to respect human rights and refrain from mutilation, murder and torture as the country spirals into anarchy.

"We appeal to all concerned to respect fundamental principles of human rights and humanitarian law, which are applicable to all persons, at all times and in all circumstances, whether in time of peace or armed conflict," the London-based rights group said in a statement.
Amnesty said basic respect for human rights should extend to members of the armed forces who lay down their arms or are unable to fight.

Specifically, it said all sides in the conflict should refrain from "violence to life and person, in particular murder of all kinds, mutilation, cruel treatment and torture; outrages upon personal dignity and humiliation and degrading treatment; taking of hostages, and detaining prisoners of conscience."

Albania's revolt began after people lost their savings in collapsed investment schemes. Political leaders have failed to quell the looting, killing and general anarchy that has ensued, with local media reporting more than 100 deaths this month.
